metadata.title: Rust
metadata.intro: The Rust quick reference cheat sheet that aims at providing help on writing basic syntax and methods.

cards.title: Hello_World.rs
cards.footer:
#### Compiling and Running

```shell
$ rustc Hello_World.rs
$ ./Hello_World
Hello, World!
```

cards.title: Primitive types
cards.body:
|                           |                                 |
| ------------------------- | :------------------------------ |
| `bool`                    | Boolean (`true` _/_ `false`)    |
| `char`                    | character                       |
| `f32`, `f64`              | 32-bits, 64-bits floats         |
| `i64`, `i32`, `i16`, `i8` | signed 16- ... integers         |
| `u64`, `u32`, `u16`, `u8` | unsigned 16-bits, ... integers  |
| `isize`                   | pointer-sized signed integers   |
| `usize`                   | pointer-sized unsigned integers |

See: [Rust Types](#rust-types)

Floating-Point

cards.footer: Use the `mut` keyword to make it mutable.

cards.title: Slices
Vectors
cards.footer: A vector is declared using the `vec!` macro.

cards.title: Tuples
String Literal
String Object
.capacity()
cards.body:
```rust
let rand = String::from("Random String");
rand.capacity() // => 13
```
cards.footer: Calculates the capacity of the string in bytes.

cards.title: .contains()
cards.body:
```rust
let name = String::from("ElementalX");
name.contains("Element") // => true
```
cards.footer: Checks if the substring is contained inside the original string or not.

cards.title: Pushing a single character
cards.body:
```rust
let mut half_text = String::from("Hal");
half_text.push('f'); // => Half
```

cards.title: Pushing an entire String
Comparison Operators
cards.body:
```rust
let (e, f) = (1, 100);

let greater = f > e;        // => true
let less = f < e;           // => false
let greater_equal = f >= e; // => true
let less_equal = e <= f;    // => true
let equal_to = e == f;      // => false
let not_equal_to = e != f;  // => true
```

cards.title: Arithmetic Operators
cards.footer:
|          |                                            |
| -------- | :----------------------------------------- |
| `a +  b` | `a` is added to `b`                        |
| `a -  b` | `b` is subtracted from `a`                 |
| `a /  b` | `a` is divided by `b`                      |
| `a % b`  | Gets remainder of `a` by dividing with `b` |
| `a * b`  | `a` is multiplied with `b`                 |

```rust {.wrap}
let (a, b) = (4, 5);

let sum: i32 = a + b;            // => 9
let subtractions: i32 = a - b;   // => -1
let multiplication: i32 = a * b; // => 20
let division: i32 = a / b;       // => 0
let modulus: i32 = a % b;        // => 4
```

cards.title: Bitwise Operators
cards.footer: | Operator | Description | | ------------------- | ----------------------- | | `g & h` | Binary AND | | g \| h | Binary OR | | `g ^ h` | Binary XOR | | `!g` | Binary one's complement | | `g << h` | Binary shift left | | `g >> h` | Binary shift right | ```rust {.wrap} let (g, h) = (0x1, 0x2); let bitwise_and = g & h; // => 0 let bitwise_or = g | h; // => 3 let bitwise_xor = g ^ h; // => 3 let right_shift = g >> 2; // => 0 let left_shift = h << 4; // => 32 ```

cards.title: Logical Operators
cards.body:
```rust
let (c, d) = (true, false);

let and = c && d;  // => false
let or = c || d;   // => true
let not = !c;      // => false
```

cards.title: Compound Assignment Operator
cards.footer: | Operator | Description | | -------------------- | --------------------------------------- | | `k += l` | Add a value and assign, then k=9 | | `k -= l` | Substrate a value and assign, then k=18 | | `k /= l` | Divide a value and assign, then k=9 | | `k *= l` | Multiply a value and assign, then k=81 | | k \|= l | Bitwise OR and assign, then k=89 |
